name: The Lodge at Tiburon

reviews.text: On the first morning in my third-floor room, a cozy, clean, and well-appointed space with a great view of Mt. Tamalpais, the silver and white-foiled coffee package next to the coffee maker on the credenza bore the imprint Larkspur Collection. On the second morning of my visit, I noticed the name on the package was different.
reviews.title: What's in a name

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What’s in a name? This question gave me pause when I realized my three-night stay coincided with a change in hotel management. As of December 15, 2011, The Lodge is no longer owned by Larkspur Hospitality, a chain of upscale boutique hotels in California, but is now in the hands of MetWest Terra.
reviews.title: Nice, Convenient Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Certainly, Tiburon, a name that means “shark,” is actually more synonymous with quiet beauty and quality. Tiburon, for example, is the first city in the world to eliminate trans-fats from all its restaurants, and in keeping with the Larkspur philosophy, the Lodge at Tiburon has long offered a beautiful kind of unpretentious comfort.
reviews.title: Lovely place-get the spa room for the huge jacuzzi tub!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My experience at The Lodge was as positive as others have written before me. From the moment the staff at the front desk greeted my arrival, I felt as if they truly cared about me and wanted me to enjoy my stay. Sweet details, like the fire pits on the patios and the flavorful fare in The Grill, make a stay in Tiburon’s Lodge seem like a stay with Bay-area friends, even though I was in town for a business meeting in The Lodge’s conference center.
reviews.title: Great place to stay while visiting Tiburon or San Francisco

reviews.text: Obviously, it remains to be seen how the change in management will affect The Lodge, but I can report a wonderful three-day visit. Happily, inside both silver and white-foiled packages was the same, delicious, organic coffee from the Carmel Valley Roasting Company.
reviews.title: Beautiful Common areas - spa room was a little dated but nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You will not be disappointed with this hotel. Very clean, great staff, and a prime location. Take the ferry from Tiburon to SanFrancisco. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel and town!

reviews.text: Located in a small town 20 minutes from the center of San Francisco, still within the bay opposite Angel Island. You have to travel over the Golden Gate Bridge to get to and from San Francisco, which is bonus for staying here. Even though there is a toll of $6 to travel in to San Francisco, it is worth it. Parking is free, unlike the expensive parking fees of the San Francisco hotels.
reviews.title: Great location near San Francisco, clean modern rooms, very good restaurant in the lodge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were spacious, clean and modernly decorated, with free WiFi.
reviews.title: no longer a larkspur property - very disappointing.

reviews.text: Is a little more expensive to stay here than some other hotels near San Francisco but it is worth it.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in quiet town close to San Francisco

reviews.text: The restaurant within the lodge, serves good food at a reasonable price, which isn't often the case in more expensive hotels. Great to not have to leave the hotel and look for a restaurant nearby.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, thin walls

reviews.text: My husband and teenage son stayed at the Lodge at Tiburon in June 2009. This is such a quaint little town and the lodge itself was great. We ended up with a top floor room, so we had vaulted ceilings. The room was beautifully decorated and the beds were so comfy.... which was necessary since my husband got the flu while we were there... that is another story. The restaurant's food was good.. not spectacular. I loved the little shopping area adjacent to the hotel. It provided an opportunity for exercise and some shopping. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to stay near SF, but not directly in the city.
reviews.title: Loved, Loved, Loved this little town and Lodge!

reviews.text: I came to Tiburon to write and was looking for a quiet hotel, but still equipped with all the amenities a business traveler is seeking. Upon arrival, Tam, the receptionist was more than accommodating and showed me 6 rooms. From all the hotels I’ve been in around the world, he was the most courteous and accommodating receptionist that I’ve ever encountered.
reviews.title: Tam was the best

reviews.text: At the end of the hotel tour, I ended up in the room that had been already reserved for me. I had to choose to either have a smaller room with a great oversized tub or a larger room with a good desk. Guilt reminded me why I was there, so the tub went. However, I loved the room, which was bright and large. The bathroom was kind of small and the hardware on the door was sticking out, so because of the little wiggle room in there, my clothes were caught behind the wrongly attached hardware on the door and it ripped up my clothing. I mentioned it to the front desk to have maintenance look at it, but I don’t think they took me very seriously because 2 days later when I returned to the same room the faulty hardware was still dangerously grinning at me. O, well. You can’t have it all.
reviews.title: Great rooms - location & staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedding really needs some ironing and the sheets could be crisper. The room that I was in had a door to an adjoining room, which made it sometimes noisy at night depending on the guests. The desk staff swiftly dealt with remarks about it and the guests were immediately accommodating and quiet. Thank you guests as well as staff.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is perfect, close to the ferry (which I never took) that can take you to San Francisco or to Angel Island (hope it is still open when I go back in August).
reviews.title: good service, comfy bed, tacky room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tiburon has the feel of a sleepy little town, but with a fantastic view of the San Francisco skyline just across the bay. The Lodge, though, is a block or so back from the waterfront, so has no water view. It’s a very comfortable inn, but be forewarned that it is under new management and is currently undergoing renovation. There was no unreasonable noise – we were not bothered – but there is construction going on. Many of the rooms have large hot tubs that sit in bay windows (with mirrored ceilings no less!), but these are apparently now considered outdated and are being removed. So for now, you have the option to choose a room with a hot tub or without. Check-in staff were pleasant, if a bit disorganized, and struggled a bit to provide good local advice. We only tried the restaurant once for breakfast and were underwhelmed. Dave and Mike’s, a tiny diner across the street, is a local landmark and a better choice for breakfast. We did not try dinner in-house, but instead ventured a block down the road to the waterfront. Guaymas, a Mexican restaurant was our favorite there, with great margaritas, tasty food, beautiful views, and a nice warm fire to warm us on a windy cool evening. Just next to Guaymas is the ferry dock, where you can catch a boat to Angel Island or to San Francisco. In short, the Lodge and Tiburon offer a nice quiet, comfortable retreat from the bustle and high prices of the city while still having all of San Francisco (and Marin County) practically at your fingertips. We’d go back.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a Lovely Town

reviews.text: I was here for a work training, and it is the perfect place for that - small enough that it has an intimate feel yet legit facility with all needs met. It might have been the MOST relaxing work-related conference type of even ever. The little town of Tiburon is precious, local eateries, shops, old-school movie theatre - awesome. I even stayed an extra day due to flight plans and so glad I did. The was amazing, very accomodating and there was fruity water in the lobby...different fruit theme each day.
reviews.title: Relaxing and spritual

reviews.text: Will go back here one day, for sure.
reviews.title: Mirrors everywhere including the ceiling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently stayed 4 nights at this property, and was put in a king room (by the way the bed was not a true king size). Since this time I was traveling alone, the small "king" bed was not a real problem. If my husband had been with me, it would have been a real problem as we are used to a full king bed. The room was a little tired with a need of fresh carpeting and some new grout in the shower tiles. The biggest problem for me was the mirrors on the ceiling above the bed, along two full walls, and above the gigantic hot tub which I did not use. The room faced the back and seemed a bit dark and gloomy. I hadn't planned on spending much time in the room but would have preferred a brighter view and an easier way to open a window. I had to climb into the hot tub to adjust the shades and open or close the windows. I ended up not opening the windows and I kept the shades shut. My advice before booking this hotel is to confirm what a "King Spa" room really entails.
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: In fact, I did not ask for the "spa" element but this was the last available room. Room could also use an updated TV.
reviews.title: Nice but a bit dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed here several times and my experience has varied from good to just fair. Most rooms are old and strangely laid out. No electrical outlets within 20 feet of the desk, no nighttable on one side of the bed. Worn carpeting.
reviews.title: A strange hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First room this last time we were shown to smelled of sewerage. Yet the bellman said nothing. Called to move and the front desk was unresponsive until we called the manager.
reviews.title: Great spot for the money

reviews.text: Service is spotty. Pool was all out of towels; in spite of people calling and waiting 30 minutes, no response. Found the manager and he had no idea that people were waiting.
reviews.title: Great chill out from San Fran - in the sun

reviews.text: The restaurant, bar, patio, lobby and pool area are all very good. Would recommend with reservations that you get one of the newer rooms.
reviews.title: Numerous Mediocre to Poor Experiences

reviews.text: We had a room with a hot tub included. Very roomy and lots of nice touches like chocolate on the pillow. The bed was wonderful with plenty of pillows and soft linens. The bathroom was nice but there were no shelves to put toiletries on which is a major issue if you are with your wife! How hard can it be to put up some shelves?
reviews.title: Lovely but could be cleaner

reviews.text: We booked one of the Lodge's superior rooms directly on their website and got a great prepaid deal.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reviews on Tripadvisor would appear to indicate that it's a bit hit and miss in this hotel, but our experiance really was a hit.
reviews.title: Intimate and tranquil inn with tasteful decor and tasty cuisine.

reviews.text: The room was newly refurbished, with a nice contemporary feel and subdued tones. it looked out the back, onto one of the residential hills above downtown Tiburon, and was very quiet.
reviews.title: Great location in Tiburon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom was also brand new, with plenty of towels and some lovely products ( L'Occitane, I believe) and a bath, which our little one appreciated. Even the coffee provided in the room was of a high standard - not your usual weak 'American' stuff, it had real bold flavour.
reviews.title: Nice but pricey

reviews.text: While it is true that this is a obviously a motel which has undergone/ is undergoing a facelift - you can tell from the walkways instead of corridors- we enjoyed our stay there.
reviews.title: Nice hotel and location but something lacking in the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here over the Valentine weekend in one of the traditional rooms. Spacious room and clean but nothing special. The heater is too tiny for the size of room--just one small vent--and thank goodness there's also one in the bathroom. We tried to upgrade our room but as one would expect the place was fully booked for the weekend. We happened to see another room while it's being cleaned and it's so much nicer than ours. I guess you get what you pay for, although even the lowest rate is still not that low given the location. Tiburon is a nice small town but there's not as much to do or walk to. Overall a pleasant stay and if we were to stay at The Lodge again, we'd choose a higher type of room.
reviews.title: Not so special

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Lodge at Tiburon for a quick one night, two day getaway. Upon arriving at the Lodge at Tiburon, the front entrance is very nice and modern. The lobby as others have mentioned is inviting and warm.
reviews.title: Tiburon Getaway

reviews.text: We stayed in a room with a hot tub. Good size room, bathroom is considered average in size. Overall, we were pleased with the room, the hot tub was excellent and a bonus to have in the room. We did not see any mold or other negative things in the room as others may have mentioned.
reviews.title: Some great points, some not so great...
It's a gamble
reviews.text: The staff is good, I think the hotel was half occupied, probably due to the Christmas holidays.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate at Guaymas, a Mexican restaurant overlooking the bay into San Francisco. The food was good, the service was terrible. Our waiter was less than enthusiastic to be working, too bad it showed.
reviews.title: Beware of booking through online resources

likes.disliked: — Staff and the way the business is conducted. The hotel takes advantage of the internet resources who advertise their hotel (would not have ever heard of the hotel if it hadn't been for Expedia) as well as their customers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our room at this hotel. We had reserved a Delixe King room and when arriving asked if they had any of the rooms with hot tubs and they had one left so they gave it to us, very good desk service. The room was spacious and really nice decor except there was odd tilework in the shower/toilet and bad fan, lighting as if they forgot to redecorate this area. This was a minor complaint though as we really loved the room, bed was comfy, and great location in Tiburon. Excellent deal for all that the hotel has to offer.
reviews.title: Romantic stay in Tiburon

reviews.text: the only reason my family choose to stay at the Lodge at Tiburon is because it had a pool and hot tub. However, the pool was closed for a few weeks, starting a few days prior to our arrival. We were not notified. When checking out, i complained (I was already checked in and in my room before i noticed myself they were empty), I was offered neither an apolopgy nor a discount. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone. Just terrible, and they made me feel even worse on my way out.
reviews.title: No pool, no apologies

reviews.text: I have used this hotel for some time as a means of getting away on business trips. Why fight the crowds of SF, when for a few minutes drive you can be in Tiburon. Great places to eat, including the famous Sam's Anchor Bar down the street. But back to the hotel. The very updated bar is a favorite for locals that always make a stay better. While the property is not new, it has been remodeled and is very nice. Only one slight problem, just one elevator, so if you need that help, it is a bit slow. Otherwise, the staff is fantastic, the rooms, large and comfortable, the location, very nice.
reviews.title: Welcome Stay

reviews.text: We stayed here for a two day sales meeting which was brill. The rooms we were brilliant, but remember to switch the heating on when it is cold!!
reviews.title: Great Place For A Sales Meeting

reviews.text: The service provided by the hotel staff was first class.
reviews.title: Great for families

aka: The Lodge At Tiburon Hotel Tiburon
description: Stay Nestled. Across the spectacular San Francisco Bay, The Lodge at Tiburon is an easy, sublime escape from the noise of the city. Only steps away from the Bay docks, the hotel provides a quaint retreat nestled among the cafes, boutiques and galleries of Tiburon and is adorned with relaxing décor and an inviting ambiance. The Lodge at Tiburon offers quintessential Northern California living at its best, striving to offer a personalized experience tailored to guest’s individual needs and interests, from the complimentary wireless high speed Internet, DVD players and movie libraries, to a full service business center and a knowledgeable concierge program, including the I-pad wall. Gilchrist and Soames bath and body products, high-tech efficiencies and a warm, welcoming atmosphere. The on-property restaurant, Tiburon Tavern, serves a delicious selection of locally farmed elevated comfort cuisine. With two outdoor patios and two indoor fireplaces, Tiburon Tavern is the ideal place to relax and enjoy an evening with family and friends.
